moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. Bg5 Ne4 3. Bf4 d5 4. e3 Bf5 5. f3 Nf6 6. c4 e6 7. Nc3 c6 8. g4 Bg6 9. h4 h6 10. Qb3 b6
comment:
I was confident that Iain would not play 10...Qb6. In the
last two Championship tournaments Iain had given me a lesson on how to play
and literally ripped my Kings head off! I was sure he would want to keep
Queens on.

Bxe7 Qxe7 18. e4 Ne3 19. h6 Rd8 20. Rg1 Bg6 21. Rxg6 fxg6 22. Bxe6+ Kh8 23. hxg7+ Kxg7 24. Ne2 Nc2+ 25. Qxc2 Qxe6 26. Qc3 Kg8 27. Ng4 Rf8 28. Kd2 Nd7 29. d5
comment:
This looked wrong initially, it appears to open up the c file
for Black, but in reality it is to White's advantage with moves such as Qc7 -
h2 and Rh1.
